Cambodia: King Sattha requested protection from the Spanish governor of the Philippines against the Thai.
China: Siege of Pyongyang: A combined Ming-Joseon force drove the Japanese army from Pyongyang.
England: The Act Against Papists 1593 was issued.
Philippine: Doctrina Christiana in Spanish and Tagalog is published in the first printing press said to be established by Dominicans.

Dominicans pioneer printing in the Philippines by producing through the old technique of xylography. This technique produced the Doctrina Christiana en Lengua Española y Tagala and the Doctrina Christiana en Lengua y Letra China, the first books in the Philippines
Slovenia: The Battle of Sisak restores the balance of power and brings the expansion of the Ottoman Empire into the Slovene Lands to a halt.
Taiwan: Ming officials issue ten licenses each year for Chinese junks to trade in northern Taiwan
